Document Sources.Sourced Statement: According to Associated Press election data, Niobrara County’s Democrats, who account for just 2.6% of registered voters, are the most outnumbered by Republicans in the 30 states that track local party affiliation.
Document Sources.Source Justification: According to Associated Press election data

Document Sources.Sourced Statement: Nationwide, Democrats account for fewer than 3% of voters in three counties this year, up from one county in 2020 but down from seven in 2016. There were none with such a low percentage of Democratic registrations in the presidential election years of 2012, 2008 and 2004, according to the AP data.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Her neighbors call her “the crazy Democrat,” although it’s more a term of endearment than derision.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Her neighbors call her “the crazy Democrat,” although it’s more a term of endearment than derision.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Normally I just roll my eyes and walk away because I’m fighting a losing battle and I’m fully aware of that,” she said. “Maybe that is why I’m well-liked, because I keep my mouth shut 10 times more than I want to.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: A paralegal for the Republican county attorney, Blackburn hears a lot of right-wing views around town.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: Not that she’s politically shy. She flies an LGBTQ+ flag in support of her lesbian daughter at her house in Lusk, a ranching town of 1,500 and the Niobrara County seat.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Not that she’s politically shy. She flies an LGBTQ+ flag in support of her lesbian daughter at her house in Lusk, a ranching town of 1,500 and the Niobrara County seat.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: In political season, Blackburn stocks up on Democratic political signs to replace those that get swiped. She speaks approvingly of policing reform, taxation for government services and the transgender social media celebrity Dylan Mulvaney.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: In political season, Blackburn stocks up on Democratic political signs to replace those that get swiped. She speaks approvingly of policing reform, taxation for government services and the transgender social media celebrity Dylan Mulvaney.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I won two elections here. Even though that’s nonpartisan, people still knew I had left-leaning values,” she said.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Blackburn really does seem well-liked in Lusk, where she recently served nine years on the Town Council.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “You feel skeevy and dirty when you do it. But you do it anyway and you change it back as soon as you can, because you don’t want to start getting the Republican mailings,” Blackburn said.
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: “You feel skeevy and dirty when you do it. But you do it anyway and you change it back as soon as you can, because you don’t want to start getting the Republican mailings,” Blackburn said.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I am who I am, and I have the views that I have,” she said. “And I don’t care if it bothers people or not.”
Named Person Sources.Title of Source: paralegal for the Republican county attorney
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Blackburn, for one, intends to hold her political ground, even as it shrinks around her.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “How far are they going to go to limit one’s ability to vote? If it really comes down to purifying the party, on a voting level all the way up to the elected officials, pretty soon there isn’t going to be anyone left who’s pure enough to be in the party,” Diercks said.
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: The new law keeping Diercks and others from switching their registration so easily has him exasperated with the GOP.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “The best way to participate in meaningful change is to try to sway the dominant party,” said Jordan, who lives in Niobrara County. “You know, we need to have a government that serves the people, all of them, not just Republicans and not just rural and not just urban and not just Democrats — and definitely not just the rich and the wealthy.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Truck driver Pat Jordan supports many left-leaning goals, including universal healthcare, but said he only registers as a Republican.

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “Most people don’t want to dive into those type of discussions,” he said. “They respect you for what you do, how you work.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: He said people know his views but rarely put him on the spot about politics.

Named Organization Sources.Sourced Statement: Party-switching had “undermined the sanctity of Wyoming’s primary process,” Wyoming’s Republican secretary of state, Chuck Gray, said in a statement of approval.
Named Organization Sources.Source Justification: Wyoming’s Republican secretary of state, Chuck Gray, said in a statement of approval
